question: What is the effect of incorporating  degree‐heterogeneous networks structure in an SEIR model on disease dynamics, compared to a homogeneous‐mixing network? Analyze it using both deterministic analytical methods and stochastic simulations
next_plan: We have completed initial discovery, built ER (homogeneous) and BA (degree-heterogeneous) networks, calibrated beta to match R0, ran stochastic SEIR simulations, produced results files results-11.csv and results-12.csv, and extracted key metrics. Next steps: (1) Formalize deterministic analytical comparison using moment-closure or next-generation matrix to derive epidemic thresholds and expected final size for both network types; (2) Refine analysis of simulation outcomes, produce plots (time series, degree distributions) and compile metrics table; (3) Write comprehensive LaTeX report with sections title to appendices, citing literature obtained from review; (4) Generate figures and save in output folder; (5) finalize paper LaTeX string.

question: What is the effect of incorporating  degree‐heterogeneous networks structure in an SEIR model on disease dynamics, compared to a homogeneous‐mixing network? Analyze it using both deterministic analytical methods and stochastic simulations
next_plan: We generated deterministic degree-based mean-field solutions and produced plots + metrics.
